Documentation for this format

name: LIVDObservationDefinition
title: LIVDObservationDefinition
publisher: HL7 International - Orders and Observations Work Group
description: Explanation of what this profile contains/is for

element.comment: Provides an alternate reference identifier by which the IVD Test is known.  Only the identifier.value is required.

In addition to the required category valueset, this element allows various categorization schemes based on the owner’s definition of the category and effectively multiple categories can be used at once. The level of granularity is defined by the category concepts in the value set.
element.requirements: Used for filtering what observations are retrieved and displayed.

element.comment: Contains both the IVD Test Code and Name of the analyte.

element.definition: data type allowed for the result of the observation.
Multiple results allowed for this kind of observation.
The preferred name to be used when reporting the results of this observation.
Customary unit used to report quantitative results of this observation.
SI unit used to report quantitative results of this observation.
number of digits after decimal separator when the results of this observation are of type Quantity.
Reference range for ordinal and continuous observations.
element.requirements: multiple reference ranges, for different patient contexts.

element.definition: The value and associated unit of the low bound (inclusive) of the reference range.
element.requirements: The unit may be not relevant for ordinal values. In case it is there, it is the same as SIunit or customaryUnit.

element.definition: Codes to indicate what part of the targeted reference population it applies to. For example, the normal or therapeutic range.
element.requirements: what kind of reference range this is - normal, recommended, therapeutic, etc., - for proper interpretation.
target population (male, female, pregnancy, a specific race ….
Some analytes vary greatly over age.

element.definition: The gestational age at which this reference range is applicable, in the context of pregnancy.
The set of valid coded results for the observation.
The set of normal coded results for the observation.
The set of abnormal coded results for the observation.
The set of critical coded results for the observation.
